ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Varied, but anywhere from 2-10
It depended on the week as some weeks but generally around 5/6, more if an assignment was due that week
depending on the week, 3-8 hours per week
5-20 hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Absolutely incredible. My advice would be that it should meet once a week for 2 hours. You just learn SOOO much. Not only SPSS and questionnaire development skills, but also how to effectively work with a group.

You get to pick whatever topic you want as well as whether you want to work in a group or independently which is great. Going through the entire process of developing the questionnaire and then collecting and analyzing data is super rewarding. As ambitious as it is Marney makes this accomplishable with minimal stress. The critique seemed a little unnecessary though.
great course, the semester project is a great learning experience

The course is very practical in that we learn the theory behind questionnaire development and then get to actually put that theory into practice. I think this is a major strength of the course and I learnt so much. I also think the way the course is structured is very helpful, things build on each other.The only difficulty was that there was a bit of a rush to try to get expert feedback on our measure but overall it worked out fine and given the time constraints of the course I'm unsure how this could really be changed.

The course is fantastic - definitely in my top favorite courses. It's a great skills-based, practical course.the lectures& other assignment (the article critique) were good compliments to the project.No weaknessesâ¦.love the timing of the class and having the group time blocked off at the beginning of the semesterlearned so much in the class

strengths: goes in depth on aspects of questionnaire development and statistics that we were never exposed to in other classes. Marney tries to find different ways of introducing content other than lecturing.

I thought that our group research project was a great experience and it wasn't too overwhelming because we were guided through each step of the process. However, I might have appreciated a bit more structure in terms of lectures

This course is great because you actually learn how to develop a questionnaire from start to finish. I feel comfortable replicating these steps in the future. Questionnaires are great because you can do amazing research with a minimal budget.

I really liked that we got to design our own questionnaires and own the whole process.Eventually, I understood the whole Cronbach's alpha thing, but I think the lecture on this could be improved a bit. The instructor seemed kind of bored - and I can see why if you've explained this a bunch of times - but it's really important to understand. And, I think it can be fun! Maybe with concrete examples of past projects, for example, showing their measures and what they mean.
Great. I learned a lot and can definitely see myself applying these skills to the future.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is wonderful and perfect in every way!!
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is amazing. Great lectures (even when content was dull) and high concern about student progress. She really kept everyone on track.
Instructor: Marney A. White  So incredibly helpful and willing to go above and beyond for her students :)

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is a fantastic instructor! Not only is she extremely knowledgeable, with lots of experience, she makes classes fun. You can see that she genuinely cares about teaching and cares that her students understand the material. She makes classes as engaging as possible even when some of the material is quite dry. She is also always available to students for help or feedback. I learnt so much in this class and it's because Marney took the time to really teach the material and engage with students.
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney, like her course, is fantastic! Her lectures are great and she always has interesting comments/anecdotes to addShe's also really encouraging and motivating

Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is an expert in her area and is one of the best professors I have had. She is passionate about what she does, and takes the time to ensure that we are all moving at the same pace. She keeps us interested with her stories of her own work, and is always accessible to students. Marney is also the only professor who ever discusses how to publish in class, which is something we should be exposed to more. The only improvement would be to have her teach more classes.
Instructor: Marney A. White  really responsive and great feedback, I really enjoyed her teaching style and the lectures (and stories!)

Instructor: Marney A. White  Caring, sweet, down to earth and very intelligent. I don't have enough words to describe how amazing Marney is. She is always so cheerful and she is full of great stories! Never change Marney! She even won an award for her teaching!
Instructor: Marney A. White  Marney is great!! Very enthusiastic and gives very helpful comments on the papers.
Instructor: Marney A. White  GREAT INSTRUCTOR! Thank you for always being supportive and going out of your way to help us.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Elizabeth is wonderful and dedicated. She takes the time to read drafts and is available for questions and support. Her feedback is good, though in a way I wish she would be a little bit more critical so that what we turn in can meet Marney's standards. Overall, she's an awesome TA and gives super helpful advice, even about things unrelated to class.
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Elizabeth was very accessible via email and did good at clearing things up.
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  wasn't really involved much with the class that I could notice
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Elizabeth was a really wonderful TA who always gave quick feedback throughout the course and was always available to students.
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  not much contact with her but was great as far as I know

Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Elizabeth is always available to students. She is a great mentor and motivator. She responds quickly to questions and is great at clarifying anything that wasn't understood in the lesson. Awesome TA.
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  responsive to our questions and concerns, and always willing to help
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Sweet, caring, and always willing to help. She was always available and willing to answer our endless questions.
Instructor: Elizabeth A Claydon  Elizabeth was always responsive and supportive.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is just so much FUN!!! I would recommend taking anything that Marney teaches - she is just the best. My advice would be to choose a topic that you are passionate about, and to choose your group wisely because the group dynamic can really make or break the experience. Make sure you communicate with your group members about your goals, and expectations. If there are issues, don't wait until the last minute to address them. Discuss them at the outset. If there are concerns, you can always go to Marney about anything.I would also suggest trying to publish your final product. Marney will be really helpful for that.
It's a fun and rewarding class. You will end up with your own dataset and potentially a publishable paperwhich Marney is more than willing to help guide you with!
great course if you think you might want to design studies in the future

For a fellow student I would say if you really want to learn the ins and outs of questionnaire development ( which I think is a pretty vital skill within Public Health) this course is one that you have to take. It will require work and time but will be such a valuable learning experience and one which builds hard skills that can be used throughout your career.
I would strongly recommend this course! It is a great practical course for career development

This course allows students to understand how questionnaires are created, and also to understand how valuable or weak current questionnaires are. This class also will allow students insight on how to write papers and publish. It's a practical and fun class.
fun, good class in terms of experience in learning how to write a reliable, valid questionnaire

I definitely recommend the course, but I suggest you have aproject and group in mind. With classes like this, a lot of the experience can be influenced by your group and project. What I like about this course is that you actually do learn how to develop a questionnaire and you have the chance of publishing your work. Marney is willing to help you publish, even after the class is done.
Yes! Especially if you want to publish, this is a good course.
Great! Would suggest this course to all students.
